html.h2: Started the client, but not seeing any logs. Why?
html.p: The eStreamer Summary dashboard will always keep you abreast of the eStreamer client status -- look there first to see if it's running or not. If any error or problem is indicated, click on the status or go to the Help > Client Status page to see more a more detailed status.

Another worthwhile thing to do when first setting up the app is to ensure the verbose logging is enabled in Settings. This will write STDOUT and STDERR messages to a file ($APP_PATH/bin/estreamer_debug.log) for determining how the eStreamer client may be failing.

html.h2: What does the client status "SFPkcs12 : Unable to get certificate" mean?
html.p: If the eStreamer client status is presenting this error, it generally means that the certificate password is missing or incorrect. Double-check the password in the app Settings to ensure it matches what was entered during certificate creation.

html.h2: I have Splunk installed on Windows, why does the app not work?
html.p: At this point in time, the app is designed only to work on Unix platforms such as Linux.

html.h2: How do I configure the app on a Universal Forwarded where there is no Splunk UI?
html.p: As of version 2.1.1, a shell script has been added to help configure the app from the command-line. The script is located in the app bin/ directory and has the name config_nogui.sh. This script should even properly interpret the existing configuration and prompt for new values.
The Splunk instance may need to be restarted after being configured.
